content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my preference for security and avoidance of risk, I would likely choose 'B' throughout the 75 rounds. Choosing 'R' could result in receiving no payoff if my opponent chooses 'B'. On the other hand, choosing 'B' guarantees a consistent payout of 20$ per round when my opponent also chooses 'B', and I would still earn 40$ for every round where my opponent chooses 'R'. This strategy provides more stability and certainty in terms of income. However, it is important to note that this game is known as a Stag Hunt game, and the Nash Equilibrium in this game is for both players to choose 'R', which would result in a higher payoff (45$) for each player. But given my risk-averse personality, I would likely stick with 'B'. {B}
